summary: This is a marketing email from ECPAT-USA to the FBI, promoting their Public Conversations Resource Guide for members of Congress to address sex trafficking in their communities. It references the Jeffrey Epstein case in the context of a blog series by interns exploring youth, social media, and society.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Subject of case referenced in blog series
persons.context: Mentioned as the subject of a recent case that is explored in ECPAT-USA's '#NOFILTER' blog series by interns discussing youth, social media, and society.

events.title: Launch of Public Conversations Resource Guide
events.description: ECPAT-USA launches a new Public Conversations Resource Guide with a bipartisan event in Washington, D.C., to help members of Congress address sex trafficking in their districts.

keyFacts: ECPAT-USA is the leading anti-child trafficking organization in the United States.
The organization references the Jeffrey Epstein case in a blog series exploring youth, social media, and society.
The email is sent to an FBI email address (nic.fbi.gov), indicating outreach to law enforcement.
The resource guide is aimed at helping members of Congress address sex trafficking in their communities.
ECPAT-USA's address is listed as 30 Third Avenue, Suite 800A, Brooklyn, New York 11217.
